Materials and You A Guide to Tools and Abilities
Volume 2 By Skyla
Table of Contents

Welcome to the second edition of Materials and You: A Guide to Tools and Abilities. Within these pages you will details on every known tool, modifier, and material. A detailed breakdown of each
This book is a magic copy; it updates whenever the original has been modified. Check back occasionally for information on new things.

page.title: Wood
page.text: It seems to grow everywhere.

page.title: Stone
page.text: One of the most common materials in the world.

page.title: Iron
page.text: A staple for tools, it can be refined and processed.

page.title: Flint
page.text: More durable than stone. The material of choice for cavemen.

page.title: Cactus
page.text: A form of wood found only in the desert.

page.title: Bone
page.text: A material with many uses dead or alive.

page.title: Obsidian
page.text: Tough as nails, but fragile when shaped.

page.title: Alumite
page.text: An uncommon alloy. It seems to be quite durable.

page.title: Netherrack
page.text: This is made of what?!

page.title: Blue Slime
page.text: Converting it from food has made it stronger.

page.title: Green Slime
page.text: Soft and springy, it seems to last forever.

page.title: Paper
page.text: It's very weak, but can take a lot of modification.

page.title: Paper
page.text: It's very weak, but can take a lot of modification.

page.title: Cobalt
page.text: One of the nether materials. It's bright blue.

page.title: Ardite
page.text: One of the nether materials. It's rustic red.

page.title: Manyullyn
page.text: The nether alloy. It's stronger than diamond.

page.title: Copper
page.text: A common metal found in the ground.

page.title: Bronze
page.text: A common alloy. It's a bit better than iron.

page.title: Steel
page.text: An Iron alloy. The method for obtaining this is unknown.
